subject: Negotiation
title: The Peak-End Rule
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Peak-End Rule.

hook.text: Patients prefer a longer colonoscopy if it ends less painfully â€” even though the total discomfort is greater.

buildup.text: The peak-end rule: people judge experiences by their most intense moment and how they end, not the average.

discovery.text: Daniel Kahneman showed that ending an experience well matters more than the overall experience.

twist.text: A tough negotiation with a generous final concession is remembered more positively than an easy one with a stingy close.

climax.text: Save your best concession for last. End every deal on a high note.

punchline.text: People remember how it ended. End it well.

quiz.question: What does the peak-end rule say about how people judge experiences?
options: They calculate the average of all moments
They judge by the most intense moment and the ending
